page.title: 04OUR POST OFFICE.
page.content: The main line of communication is the Post Office.We also use the telephone for communication.Most people in Thurlby have a telephone in their home.The people who do not have telephones use the modern press button telephone boxes.They are in High St,on the Green and in Northorpe.Some people have friends in different countries so we send them letters.The Post Office provides air mail envelopes for these letters.They also have first and second class stamps for ordinary letters.The Post Office also sells National insurance stamps and savings stamps for televisions.They deliver the post to the Post Office at 9.00am and then again at 4.30pm.Then the Postman delivers it to us at 9.30am.The Post Offices services are pensions and Family allowances which are collected on Tuesdays.
